caption:
This photograph captures a lively scene from what appears to be a public demonstration or protest. Several individuals are present, mainly women, engaged in the demonstration activity. 

One prominent female figure in the foreground wears a white polka-dotted scarf tied around her head, a white top with revealing mesh or lace on the back, and black tights paired with a miniskirt. She is holding a sign that says, "YOU HAVE NOT COME A LONG WAY BABY!" in bold red and black letters, with a large red exclamation point for emphasis.

To the left of her, another woman is visible, wearing a headscarf with a checkered pattern reminiscent of the 1970s. She holds a sign stating, "Zero Population Growth supports [ERA]," indicating involvement in environmental or reproductive rights issues along with support for the Equal Rights Amendment.

In the background, glimpses of other participants can be seen, one of whom is a woman with curly hair dressed in a red blazer and blouse. There are other partially visible signs and a bicycle leaning against someone in the crowd, suggesting a casual yet politically active atmosphere. The setting is outdoors, possibly in a street or park, where various demonstrators have gathered, also suggesting the event took place during the day, under overcast lighting conditions.
title: Women's suffrage day in fountain square
